David Boyer wrote:

>If I do what?  Save the data and feed it to the Listener?  The feeding 
>of the Listener is, IMO, best implemented through MockObjects.  EasyMock 
>could easily be customized to set up parameters scripted behavior from 
>xml files.
>  
>
That really didn't come out clearly.

I can envision using some easily edited medium for registering test data 
which could be used.
I would still use MockObjects to deliver the Test Data.  If I don't I 
can't isolate the data from the runtime source.

I'm not saying your larger suite of tests wouldn't contain tests which 
run the two components together, again with mocked data starting the 
chain.  But I would definitely not be working on the Listener by using 
the combined test, I would simply work on the Listener in isolation and 
mock the expected data, till I was done.  If the higher level test 
demonstrated some flaw in my code, I would go back to the Listener and 
it's unique tests.  There I would Mock this new known bug producing data 
and prove the bug (in a test), and fix it.

If a bug shows up at this higher level of interaction, I believe that I 
have failed to express some fact contractual obligation or expectation 
of one of the lower level classes.

Thoughts?


Thanks,

David B.
